author: Special Correspondent
text:
Prince of Arcot, Nawab Mohammed Abdul Ali (right), Justice Sanjay Kishan Kaul, Chief Justice of the Madras High Court, at the felicitation of Inspector General Satya Prakash Sharma.— Photo: R. Ravindran

The Prince of Arcot, Nawab Mohammed Abdul Ali, felicitated Inspector General Satya Prakash Sharma, Commander of the Indian Coast Guard region (East), for having been awarded with the President Tatrakshak medal.

Mr. Sharma is the only officer in the Coast Guard to be conferred the Tatrakshak medal twice for his immense knowledge and contribution in the Coast Guard operations. He had earlier been awarded the Tatrakshak medal by the President of India.

The Prince lauded the services of IG Sharma for his numerous achievements in the Eastern region under his command. He also commended the Coast Guard’s efforts to rescue the people stranded during the Chennai floods.

Mr. Sharma is also set to retire from service on April 30.

Mr. Sanjay Kishan Kaul, Chief Justice of the Madras High Court, said Coast Guard was playing a good role in protecting our seas.

Recalling the efforts taken when a Coast Guard helicopter crashed in the sea, Mr. Sharma said it was a stressful period to lose three brave officers.

“It took us 37 days. But the mission also proved that we are no less than anyone,” he said turning emotional.
title: Top Coast Guard official felicitated
